title: SH 183 Archive Photos Irving
text: There has been a tremendous amount of change along SH 183 in Irving since I first collected photos for this section of freeway in the 2000s. In April 2010 Texas Stadium was demolished, and the site was used as a construction staging area in the 2010s. In 2018 major expansion was completed in Irving from Belt Line Road to Regal Road in Dallas. The Irving Interchange project, 2021-2023, finished the freeway to its ultimate design at the Texas Stadium site.

images.caption: Here the freeway crosses over a levee at the Trinity River.

imageStatus.note: New bridges were built, completed in 2018.
Texas Stadium was imploded in 2010. SH 183 adjacent to the stadium was rebuilt and expanded 2015-2018. The Irving Interchange project, 2021-2023, completed the interchange at this location.

images.caption: Looking north at Texas Stadium, with TX 183 in the foreground.

imageStatus.note: Texas Stadium was imploded in 2010. SH 183 adjacent to the stadium was rebuilt and expanded 2015-2018. The Irving Interchange project, 2021-2023, completed the interchange at this location.

images.caption: The ramp in the foreground connects from southbound Loop 12 to westbound TX 183.

imageStatus.note: Texas Stadium was imploded in 2010. This ramp was replaced by the new interchange, completed in 2018. The Irving Interchange project, 2021-2023, completed the interchange at this location.

images.caption: This view looks across SH 183 toward the site of Texas Stadium in December 2014. TxDOT built a fabrication yard to produce prestressed concrete beams for nearby highway projects, mainly the LBJ Express in North Dallas.

imageStatus.note: The fabrication yard and buildings were removed by early 2016.

images.caption: This is a closer look at the fabrication facilty and beam storage at the Texas Stadium site.

imageStatus.note: The fabrication yard and buildings were removed by early 2016.

images.caption: In March 2016 the fabrication yard had been fully removed from the Texas Stadium site, and the site was once again a brownfield, like it was after the stadium demolition in 2010.

imageStatus.note: The Irving Interchange, 2021-2023, constructed a multi-level interchange in the area in the foreground. The Texas Stadium site was used as a construction staging area in 2022.

images.caption: This March 2016 view looks east across the Texas Stadium site, showing that the fabrication yard and concrete batch plant had been fully cleared.

imageStatus.note: The Texas Stadium site was used as a construction staging area in 2022.

images.caption: This view looks east along TX 183 from the TX 161 overpass.

imageStatus.note: One managed lane in each direction was added in 2018 in the center of the freeway.

images.caption: TX 183 has its highest lane count just west of TX 161. This view looks east toward 161.

imageStatus.note: One managed lane in each direction was added in 2018 in the center of the freeway.

images.caption: This view looks west at Amon Carter Blvd. The tunnel under the former runway was at this location. Notice the blackened area on the left side of the freeway. The fire had just occurred and was still smoldering.

imageStatus.note: One managed lane in each direction was added in 2018 in the center of the freeway.
